intro: Cacalia pandurata, commonly known as the narrowleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is its bell-shaped flowers, which are typically blue to violet in color and bloom in late summer. Cacalia pandurata thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
